name: CryptoUtils
comment: Utility methods for working with message digests.

base64StringToBytes.name: base64StringToBytes
base64StringToBytes.comment:
Converts a Base 64 encoded String into list of bytes.

Decoder ignores "\r\n" sequences from input.

Accepts both URL safe and unsafe Base 64 encoded strings.

Throws a FormatException exception if input contains invalid characters.

Based on RFC 4648

bytesToBase64.name: bytesToBase64
bytesToBase64.comment:
Converts a list of bytes into a Base 64 encoded string.

The list can be any list of integers in the range 0..255, for example a message digest.

If crypto/crypto.CryptoUtils.bytesToBase64.addLineSeparator is true, the resulting string will be broken into lines of 76 characters, separated by "\r\n".

If crypto/crypto.CryptoUtils.bytesToBase64.urlSafe is true, the result is URL and filename safe.

Based on RFC 4648

bytesToHex.name: bytesToHex
bytesToHex.comment: Convert a list of bytes (for example a message digest) into a hex string.

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides crypto/crypto.CryptoUtils.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

==.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all dart-core.Objects is to return true if and only if this and crypto/crypto.CryptoUtils.==.other are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation. That is, it must be:

  • Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw or return null.

  • Reflexive: For all objects o, o == o must be true.

  • Symmetric: For all objects o1 and o2, o1 == o2 and o2 == o1 must either both be true, or both be false.

  • Transitive: For all objects o1, o2, and o3, if o1 == o2 and o2 == o3 are true, then o1 == o3 must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override the crypto/crypto.CryptoUtils.hashCode method as well to maintain consistency.

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
crypto/crypto.CryptoUtils.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to crypto/crypto.CryptoUtils.noSuchMethod in an dart-core.Invocation. If crypto/crypto.CryptoUtils.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of crypto/crypto.CryptoUtils.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart-core.NoSuchMethodError.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.
